    Documentation of the project Elektronika od podstaw

    Elektronika od podstaw is a serious game, developed by Mateusz Kowalczyk as part of a university course project, introduces players to the fundamentals of electrical circuits. The game’s goal is to teach basic principles and laws of electricity through interactive problem-solving tasks. It is intended for high school students, first-year engineering undergraduates, and anyone interested in learning the foundational concepts of electrical engineering, power systems, and electronics.

    Some visual materials used in this game originate from the textbook “Ciekawi świata. Fizyka 2. Podręcznik. Część 1. Zakres rozszerzony. Szkoły ponadgimnazjalne” by Grzegorz Kornaś, published by Wydawnictwo Pedagogiczne Operon, and from the YouTube video “The Big Misconception About Electricity” on the Veritasium channel. These materials have been used solely for educational purposes. All resources are listed in the resources.txt file located within the game’s directory.

    Packages
    Package
    Description
    pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.config
    Contains class for managing application configuration and settings.
    pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.levels
    Handles the game’s level structure, including individual levels and stages.
    pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.main
    Contains the main entry point of the application.
    pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.simulation
    Provides classes that represent electronic components.
    pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.ui
    Contains classes responsible for the graphical user interface of the application.
